headline: Harden Your Systems: Today's Focus Areas

digest_items.title: Use principle of least privilege
digest_items.why: Excessive permissions increase blast radius of compromised accounts
digest_items.fix: Grant only minimum necessary permissions for each role

digest_items.title: Review user access permissions
digest_items.why: Stale permissions from former employees pose security risk
digest_items.fix: Conduct quarterly access reviews and remove unnecessary permissions

digest_items.title: Use subresource integrity (SRI)
digest_items.why: SRI prevents compromised CDN resources from executing malicious code
digest_items.fix: Add integrity attribute to script and link tags loading external resources

digest_items.title: Scan dependencies for vulnerabilities
digest_items.why: Vulnerable dependencies are a common attack vector in supply chain attacks
digest_items.fix: Use tools like npm audit, pip-audit, or Snyk in your CI/CD pipeline

digest_items.title: Review cloud storage permissions
digest_items.why: Misconfigured S3 buckets and storage accounts lead to data leaks
digest_items.fix: Ensure buckets are private and use IAM policies for access control

digest_items.title: Implement secure software development lifecycle
digest_items.why: Security integrated throughout SDLC is more effective than bolt-on security
digest_items.fix: Include threat modeling, security reviews, and testing in each phase
